title: Panics report the column at the beginning of an indexing expression, which is ambiguous
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#[derive(Default)]
struct S {
    pub v: Vec<Vec<usize>>,
}

fn main() {
    let mut s = S::default();
    s.v.push(vec![]);
    s.v[0][0];
}
```

I expected to see this happen: The panic message should make it possible to tell whether the first indexing expression, or the second, was out of bounds.

Instead, this happened: `thread 'main' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 0', src/main.rs:9:5`

Note that column 5 is reported, which is the location of the `s` character in `s.v[0][0]`. So it's impossible to tell which indexing is at fault.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.59.0 (9d1b2106e 2022-02-23)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 9d1b2106e23b1abd32fce1f17267604a5102f57a
commit-date: 2022-02-23
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.59.0
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```
